QuestionForm: For each pair of words below, give a Code Names clue that is related to both words. Then, explain why the chosen clue is related to each of the words. If you cannot think of a clue that links a pair of words, you may choose to skip that pair by leaving the answer fields empty. For the task to be approved, 10 out of the 15 word pairs must have a valid clue and explanations. Requirements for a Code Names clue to be valid: Must be a single word (no hyphens and no spaces). Must be related to the words through meaning and not word structure. For example, "Mammal" is a valid clue for "Dog" because dogs are mammals. However, cluing "Log" for "Dog" because they rhyme or cluing "Three" for "Dog" because "Dog" is a 3-letter word are invalid. Other requirements: Explanations should begin with "WORD is related to CLUE because ...". All occurrences of the clue and word in the explanation should be in SCREAMING CASE Clues should have all characters CAPITALIZED. Example Word 1: TORCH Word 2: ICE Clue: MELT Explanation 1: TORCH is related to MELT because a TORCH is a tool that can be used to melt things. Explanation 2: ICE is related to MELT because ICE melts at room temperature. $QUESTIONS
